definition: ground beetle/(coll.) professional or entrepreneur who, unlike a 海歸|海归[hai3 gui1], has never studied overseas/(dialect) country bumpkin
to catch a turtle in a jar (idiom); to set oneself an easy target/a turkey shoot
lit. like a turtle in a jar/to be trapped (idiom)
Chinese ground beetle (Eupolyphaga sinensis), used in TCM
Yangtze giant soft-shell turtle (Rafetus swinhoei), a critically endangered species
lit. a tortoise laughing at a soft-shelled turtle for having no tail (idiom)/fig. the pot calling the kettle black

sentences.english: The problem could be properly solved if new technology of turtle rearing without sand is adopted.
sentences.chinese: 無沙養鱉新工藝可以妥善解決這一難題。

sentences.english: He fishes turtle for living in the winter and stays in deep mountains for practice in the summer.
sentences.chinese: 冬天他在江裏捕鱉爲生，夏天則隱居深山，獨自修行。

sentences.english: Effects of carnitine on adipose metabolism in Chinese soft-shelled turtles.
sentences.chinese: 肉鹼對中華鱉脂肪代謝的影響。

sentences.english: The biological and non-biological factors causing Trionyx diseases had been discussed.
sentences.chinese: 文章探討了導致鱉病的生物因素和非生物因素。

sentences.english: Some new pathogens include virus and pathogenic bacteria had been reported.
sentences.chinese: 新報了數種中華鱉病毒和病原菌等致病原。

definition: to reject/to expel/to discard/to exclude/to renounce
lower form of animal life, including insects, insect larvae, worms and similar creatures/CL:條|条[tiao2],隻|只[zhi1]/(fig.) person with a particular undesirable characteristic
snail/Taiwan pr. [gua1]/see 蝸牛|蜗牛[wo1 niu2]
